intro: Tricalysia mildbraedii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces elongated, woody capsules as fruits. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warm climates. Due to its rapid growth and showy flowers, it is often used in landscaping and as a shade tree.
